article.description: Kemy Osse drilled a pair of 3-pointers and Mareik Isom added a third and Arkansas-Little Rock held off Texas State in overtime to post a 77-74 Sun Belt Conference victory Thursday night.
article.headline: Little Rock comeback tops Texas State in overtime, 77-74
article.linkText: Little Rock comeback tops Texas State in overtime, 77-74
article.story: SAN MARCOS, Texas -- Kemy Osse drilled a pair of 3-pointers and Mareik Isom added a third and Arkansas-Little Rock held off Texas State in overtime to post a 77-74 Sun Belt Conference victory Thursday night. Josh Hagins' jumper with 19 seconds in regulation pulled Little Rock (16-2, 6-1 Sun Belt) even at 59-59 and forced the overtime period. Ethan Montalvo scored 15 first-half points to spark Texas State to a 38-28 advantage. Hagins led a second-half comeback by Little Rock, scoring 10 of his team-high 19 in the final 20 minutes of regulation. Hagins was 5 of 10 from the floor and 8 for 8 from the line. Isom scored 14 points off the Little Rock bench and Osse and Lis Shoshi each added 13 points. Montalvo hit 5 of 10 from beyond the arc and finished with 28 points to lead Texas State (8-7, 2-4). Kavin Gilder-Tilbury finished with 15 points.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
